citeinfo.title: REGMGR.VOTING_PRECINCTS
citeinfo.pubdate: REQUIRED: The date when the data set is published or otherwise made available for release.

descript.abstract: This layer has voting precincts, and election boundaries for all federal, state, and local elections.
descript.purpose: To provide precinct and election district information for use by citizens, political parties, candidates for office and the press. Map data is essential for conduct of elections.
descript.supplinf:
Virginia code requires the election boundaries map be posted in each polling place on election day. Due to the complexity of the boundaries, all four districts will not appear on the map every year. In even-numbered years, the Congressional representatives are elected, so the map is printed with the Congressional district layer. In odd-numbered years, the state and county officials are elected, so the maps are printed with layers for those districts. The State Senators serve a four-year term, so the Senate district layer is only printed on the map every four years.
In April of 2001, the General Assembly adopted the new State Senate and House of Delegate Districts. These districts were precleared by the Justice Department July 2001.
In June of 2001, the Fairfax County Board of Supervisors adopted the new Supervisor Districts. These districts were precleared by the Justice Department August 2001.
In July of 2001, the General Assembly adopted the new Congressional Districts. These districts were precleaned by the Justice Department October 2001.
In 2001, 14 new precincts were established in response to the redistricting and several polling places were relocated. In a normal year, precinct boundaries and polling places do not change unless there is population growth in an area and/or a new facility becomes available or an existing facility can no longer be used.
In 2002, 1 new precinct was created as a result of population growth and 1 polling place was temporarily relocated due to facility renovation.
In 2003, 5 new precincts were established as a result of population growth.

sngdate.caldate: REQUIRED: The year (and optionally month, or month and day) for which the data set corresponds to the ground.

idinfo.useconst: Not for use at scales greater then 1:=24000. Acknowledgement of the Fairfax County GIS branch would be appreciated in products derived from these data.
idinfo.datacred: ASI for conversion process, Fairfax County GIS and Mapping Services and Engineering Systems for reviewing the data, and various Fairfax County Agencies
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

attracc.attraccr: Attribute accuracy is tested by comparison with hardcopy sources. Reported errors are verified and updated.

dataqual.logic: Various Arc/Info commands have been used to determine the logical consistency of the data. Once the layer was created, the build command was used to create the polygon topology. If lines were found that did not intersect, they were manually broken to create a node. Dangling arcs were removed if found. Attributes were inspected using the frequency command to ensure valid values.Region, polygon, and arc-node topology exists

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy for the digital data is tested by visual comparison of the source with the hard copy.

procstep.procdesc: Step1 - The four election districts, Congressional Districts, State Senate Districts, House of Delegates Districts and Supervisors Districts, are reapportioned every 10 years in the year following the federal census as mandated by the United States Constitution. The Virginia General Assembly draws the boundaries for the Congressional, State Senate and the House of Delegates Districts in accordance with mandates of the Virginia Constitution and Virginia Election Law. The Fairfax County Board of Supervisors draws the boundaries for the County Supervisor Districts in accordance with Virginia Code. Following adoption, the new districts are submitted to the U.S.Department of Justice for preclearance under the requirements of the Voting Rights Act. The boundaries of the precincts and the locations of polling places are set by the Fairfax County Board of Supervisors as prescribed by the Virginia Election Law, following public hearings and recommendations from the Electoral Board. Precinct boundaries may be adjusted within an election district to accommodate population growth and to meet the needs of communities. Polling place locations are established for each precinct in convenient, handicapped accessible public facilities. Changes in precinct boundaries and polling place locations are also submitted to the U.S. Department of Justice for preclearance under the requirements of the Voting Rights Act.
Digitize election boundaries and boundary names from wall map.

cntorgp.cntorg: Fairfax County GIS and Mapping Services

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eaover: The features are congressional, house of delegates, and senate election boundaries and voting precincts. Each voting district has unique identifier associated with it.

cntorgp.cntorg: Fairfax County GIS and Mapping Services

distinfo.distliab: User must assume responsibility to determine the usability of this data for their purpose. A signed copy of the license agreement must be on file with the Fairfax County GIS and Mapping Services Office.

stdorder.fees:
Wall Map Data
This data set includes over 30 layers of attributed vector map data that were derived primarily from the Fairfax County 1"= 2000' and 1"= 4000' Wall Map Series.
The GIS Wall Map CD in Coverage format sells for $25. The GIS Wall Map CD in Shapefile format sells for $25.
A hard copy of our *wall maps are available at the Fairfax County Government Publications Center located at the Fairfax County Government Center Building - 12000 Government Center Pw.- Fairfax - VA. - Suite 156 - Phone # 703-324-2974 or 703-324-2975. Prices range from $1.50 to $15.00.
* Some of our hard copy maps are not for sale to the public or may be out of stock. Contact the Fairfax County Publication Center on the availabilty of which maps can be purchased.
stdorder.ordering: CD data can be requested by mail, fax, or in person. Orders will not be processed until payment is received. Acceptable forms of payment include: cash, check, or money order ( credit cards are not accecpted). The order form and license agreement can be downloaded/printed from the Fairfax County GSI Web page (http://www.fairfaxcounty.gov/maps/forms.htm) and sent to GIS and Mapping Services-12000 Government Center Pw.-Suite 117-Fairfax-VA-22035-0010. Any questions about the GIS Wall Map CD should be directed to the GIS and Mapping Services @ (703)-324-2712.

cntorgp.cntorg: Fairfax County GIS and Mapping Services
cntorgp.cntper: REQUIRED: The person responsible for the metadata information.
